title: Verify the end to end flow for listing
custom_preconds:
The user/Agency should have resale permission in PV, PVO and MPV
PV->AFP->Market Permission(MMS)
PV->Event Access->Resale Permission
PVO->Text Codes (SHIE, REPLAYE and REPLAY2E) set to true
MPV Control Center (isFan2FanEnabled) should be set to true
The user has performed a sale on MPV or PV
custom_steps:
1. Login to MPV with My Tickets Account
2. Click on View ticket Inventory
3. Select the month from the drop down
4. Click on the event
5. Select Resell from Ticket Action drop down
6. Select the ticket and click on continue
7. Verify the validate API is called to PV via vesta
8. Verify that seatgeek sends hydrated tickets payload to PV via vesta
9. Once the above call is successful seat geek should sent list call to PV
10. Verify whether the close modal is displayed in MPV
11. Click on the close modal and verify whether refresh API call is called
12. Verify the tickets status is displayed as pending resale
custom_expected:
1. Login should be successful and My Tickets Home Page is displayed
2. Event Drop down should be displayed
3. The Event should be displayed
4. The tickets should be displayed for the corresponding event
5. The tickets should be available for selection
6. A message stating that you will be redirected to seatgeek should be displayed
7. Validate API should be called from MPV and the response with JWT token should be sent to Seat Geek 
8. Seatgeek should send  hydrated tickets payload to PV via vesta and respond should be sent to SeatGeek
9. Listing call should be sent to PV via Vesta and it should be successful
10. The close modal should be displayed in MPV
11. Clicking on the close modal should send the refresh API call 
12. The ticket status should be displayed as pending resale

title: Verify the end to end flow for listing from the Hamburger Menu
custom_preconds:
The user/Agency should have resale permission in PV, PVO and MPV
PV->AFP->Market Permission(MMS)
PV->Event Access->Resale Permission
PVO->Text Codes (SHIE, REPLAYE and REPLAY2E) set to true
MPV Control Center (isFan2FanEnabled) should be set to true
The user has performed a sale on MPV or PV
custom_steps:
1. Login to MPV with My Tickets Account
2. Click on the "sell" option in the hamburger menu
3. Select the month from the drop down
4. Click on the event
5. Select the ticket and click on continue
6. Verify the validate API is called to PV via vesta
7. Verify that seatgeek sends hydrated tickets payload to PV via vesta
8. Once the above call is successful seat geek should sent list call to PV
9. Verify whether the close modal is displayed in MPV
10. Click on the close modal and verify whether refresh API call is called
11. Verify the tickets status is displayed as pending resale
custom_expected:
1. Login should be successful and My Tickets Home Page is displayed
2. Page will navigate to the Sell Tickets page
3. The Event should be displayed
4. The tickets should be displayed for the corresponding event
5. A message stating that you will be redirected to seatgeek should be displayed
6. Validate API should be called from MPV and the response with JWT token should be sent to Seat Geek 
7. Seatgeek should send  hydrated tickets payload to PV via vesta and respond should be sent to SeatGeek
8. Listing call should be sent to PV via Vesta and it should be successful
9. The close modal should be displayed in MPV
10. Clicking on the close modal should send the refresh API call 
11. The ticket status should be displayed as pending resale

title: Verify "Sell" ticket action missing when Fan2FanEnabled is disabled
custom_preconds:
The user/Agency should have resale permission in PV, PVO and MPV
PV->AFP->Market Permission(MMS)
PV->Event Access->Resale Permission
PVO->Text Codes (SHIE, REPLAYE and REPLAY2E) set to true
MPV Control Center (isFan2FanEnabled) should be set to FALSE
The user has performed a sale on MPV or PV
custom_steps:
1. Login to MPV with My Tickets Account
2. Click on View ticket Inventory
3. Select the month from the drop down
4. Click on the event
5. Select Ticket Action button
custom_expected:
1. Login should be successful and My Tickets Home Page is displayed
2. Event Drop down should be displayed
3. The Event should be displayed
4. The tickets should be displayed for the corresponding event
5. The resell option will be missing from the dropdown

custom_expected:

title: Verify event isnt listed when PV Event resale permission is disabled
custom_preconds:
The user/Agency should have resale permission in PVO and MPV
One Event should not have resale permission in PV
PV->AFP->Market Permission(MMS)
PV->Event Access->Resale Permission
PVO->Text Codes (SHIE, REPLAYE and REPLAY2E) set to FALSE
MPV Control Center (isFan2FanEnabled) should be set to true
The user has performed a sale on MPV or PV for two events (one without resell permission)
custom_steps:
1. Login to MPV with My Tickets Account
2. Click on the "sell" option in the hamburger menu
3. Select the month of the event that was disabled for resell from the drop down
custom_expected:
1. Login should be successful and My Tickets Home Page is displayed
2. Page will navigate to the Sell Tickets page
3. The Event should not be displayed, There should be a message stating "You have no events for the selected month"

title: Verify there is no sell ticket action when PV Event resale permission is disabled

PV->Event Access->Resale Permission
PVO->Text Codes (SHIE, REPLAYE and REPLAY2E) set to FALSE
MPV Control Center (isFan2FanEnabled) should be set to true
The user has performed a sale on MPV or PV for two events (one without resell permission)
custom_steps:
1. Login to MPV with My Tickets Account
2. Click on View ticket Inventory
3. Select the month of the event that was disabled for resell from the drop down
4. Click on the event
5. Select Ticket Action button
custom_expected:
1. Login should be successful and My Tickets Home Page is displayed
2. Event Drop down should be displayed
3. The Event should be displayed
4. The tickets should be displayed for the corresponding event
5. The sell option will be missing from the dropdown

title: Verify closing the SeatGeek modal will not open a new SeatGeek tab
custom_preconds:
The user/Agency should have resale permission in PV, PVO and MPV
PV->AFP->Market Permission(MMS)
PV->Event Access->Resale Permission
PVO->Text Codes (SHIE, REPLAYE and REPLAY2E) set to true
MPV Control Center (isFan2FanEnabled) should be set to true
The user has performed a sale on MPV or PV
custom_steps:
1. Login to MPV with My Tickets Account
2. Click on View ticket Inventory
3. Select the month from the drop down
4. Click on the event
5. Select Resell from Ticket Action drop down
6. Select the ticket and click on continue
7. Close the modal
custom_expected:
1. Login should be successful and My Tickets Home Page is displayed
2. Event Drop down should be displayed
3. The Event should be displayed
4. The tickets should be displayed for the corresponding event
5. The tickets should be available for selection
6. A modal stating that you will be redirected to seatgeek should be displayed
7. A new SeatGeek tab will not open

title: Verify tickets are unable to resell from Buyer Types that enabled resale restrictions
custom_preconds:
The user/Agency should have resale permission in PVO and MPV
The user/Agency should have resale permission in PV except for the buyer type
PV->AFP->Market Permission(MMS)
PV->Event Access->Resale Permission
PV -> Buyer Types -> Restrict Resales
PVO->Text Codes (SHIE, REPLAYE and REPLAY2E) set to true
MPV Control Center (isFan2FanEnabled) should be set to true
The user has performed a sale on MPV or PV using the restricted resell buyer type and an unrestricted buyer type
custom_steps:
1. Login to MPV with My Tickets Account
2. Click on View ticket Inventory
3. Select the month from the drop down
4. Click on the event
5. Select Resell from Ticket Action drop down
custom_expected:
1. Login should be successful and My Tickets Home Page is displayed
2. Event Drop down should be displayed
3. The Event should be displayed
4. The tickets should be displayed for the corresponding event
5. The tickets should not be available for selection if they are purchased with the restricted resale buyer type

title: Verify tickets are unable to resell from sale types that enabled resale restrictions
custom_preconds:
The user/Agency should have resale permission in PVO and MPV
One of the three Resale Sale Type Restriction (Single, Group, Package) is enabled in PV
PV->AFP->Market Permission(MMS)
PV->Event Access->Resale Permission
PV -> Event Admin -> Self-Service Printing Sale Type Restriction
PVO->Text Codes (SHIE, REPLAYE and REPLAY2E) set to true
MPV Control Center (isFan2FanEnabled) should be set to true
The user has performed a sale on MPV or PV using the restricted resell sale type and an unrestricted sale type
custom_steps:
1. Login to MPV with My Tickets Account
2. Click on View ticket Inventory
3. Select the month from the drop down
4. Click on the event
5. Select Resell from Ticket Action drop down
custom_expected:
1. Login should be successful and My Tickets Home Page is displayed
2. Event Drop down should be displayed
3. The Event should be displayed
4. The tickets should be displayed for the corresponding event
5. The tickets should not be available for selection if they are purchased with the restricted resale sale type

3. The Event should be displayed
4. The tickets should be displayed for the corresponding event
5. The tickets should not be available for selection if they are purchased with comp buyer type

title: Verify tickets can not be listed if they are already listed
custom_preconds:
The user/Agency should have resale permission in PV, PVO and MPV
PV->AFP->Market Permission(MMS)
PV->Event Access->Resale Permission
PVO->Text Codes (SHIE, REPLAYE and REPLAY2E) set to true
MPV Control Center (isFan2FanEnabled) should be set to true
The user has performed a sale on MPV or PV
The user has listed the tickets on SeatGeek
custom_steps:
1. Login to MPV with My Tickets Account
2. Click on View ticket Inventory
3. Select the month from the drop down
4. Click on the event 
5. Verify the tickets status is displayed as pending resale
6. Select Resell from Ticket Action drop down
custom_expected:
1. Login to MPV with My Tickets Account
2. Click on View ticket Inventory
3. Select the month from the drop down
4. The tickets should be displayed for the corresponding event 
5. The ticket status should be displayed as pending resale
6. The tickets should not be available for selection if they have already been listed (labeled Pending Resale)

title: Verify tickets can not be listed if they are already forwarded
custom_preconds:
The user/Agency should have resale permission in PV, PVO and MPV
PV->AFP->Market Permission(MMS)
PV->Event Access->Resale Permission
PVO->Text Codes (SHIE, REPLAYE and REPLAY2E) set to true

The user has performed a sale on MPV or PV
The user has forwarded the tickets to another patron
custom_steps:
1. Login to MPV with My Tickets Account
2. Click on View ticket Inventory
3. Select the month from the drop down
4. Click on the event 
5. Verify the tickets status is displayed as Forwarded
6. Select Resell from Ticket Action drop down

2. Click on View ticket Inventory
3. Select the month from the drop down 
4. The tickets should be displayed for the corresponding event 
5. The ticket status should be displayed as forwarded
6. The tickets should not be available for selection if they have already forwarded (labeled Forwarded)

title: Verify tickets can not be forwarded if they have been listed

PV->AFP->Market Permission(MMS)
PV->Event Access->Resale Permission
PVO->Text Codes (SHIE, REPLAYE and REPLAY2E) set to true

The user has listed tickets on SeatGeek

4. Click on the event 
5. Verify the tickets status is displayed as pending sale
6. Select Forward from Ticket Action drop down
custom_expected:

2. Click on View ticket Inventory
3. Select the month from the drop down 
4. The tickets should be displayed for the corresponding event 
5. The ticket status should be displayed as forwarded
6. The tickets should not be available for selection if they have already listed to sell (labeled pending resale)

title: Verify tickets can be resold once they have been removed from SeatGeek listing
custom_preconds:
The user/Agency should have resale permission in PV, PVO and MPV
PV->AFP->Market Permission(MMS)
PV->Event Access->Resale Permission
PVO->Text Codes (SHIE, REPLAYE and REPLAY2E) set to true
MPV Control Center (isFan2FanEnabled) should be set to true
The user has performed a sale on MPV or PV
The user has listed the ticket on Seat Geek

2. Login to MPV with My Tickets Account

4. Select the month from the drop down

3. Click on View ticket Inventory
4. Select the month from the drop down

6. The ticket status should be displayed as forwarded
7. The tickets should not be available for selection if they have been listed to sell (labeled pending resale)

title: Verify tickets can not be printed when they are listed
Verify tickets can not be forwarded via API if they have been listed
